architectureStyle.description: Brutal warrior fortress architecture - imposing, angular, built to intimidate and defend
keyElements: Massive dark stone walls with metal reinforcements
Angular, aggressive shapes - pointed spires and battlements
Red accent lighting from torches and energy conduits
Trophy displays - enemy weapons, skulls, banners of conquered foes
Heavy blast doors and defensive positions
Training grounds and combat arenas integrated
Qo'noS volcanic/industrial aesthetic - dark, smoky, powerful
NO soft curves, NO glass domes, NO gardens - this is a WARRIOR culture
Banners and flags with House insignias
architectureStyle.colors: Dark gray stone, gunmetal, red accent lights, bronze/copper trim, black iron
architectureStyle.materials: Volcanic stone, heavy duranium plating, iron spikes, leather banners

buildings.name: Great Hall of the High Council
buildings.description: Massive fortress where the Klingon High Council meets. Towering central spire, throne room, surrounded by warrior statues

buildings.name: Chancellor's Fortress
buildings.description: Imposing residence of the Empire's supreme leader, heavily fortified with personal guard barracks

buildings.name: House Stronghold
buildings.description: Noble House ancestral fortress. Defensive walls, family trophy room, armory, great dining hall for feasts

buildings.name: Council Chamber
buildings.description: Meeting hall where warriors and politicians settle disputes through debate or combat

buildings.name: Emperor's Palace
buildings.description: Ancient seat of the Klingon Emperor, restored after centuries, filled with sacred relics of Kahless

buildings.name: Colonial Governance Hall
buildings.description: Administrative fortress for conquered or colonized worlds, projecting Klingon authority

buildings.name: Warrior Academy
buildings.description: Brutal training facility for young warriors. Combat arenas, weapons halls, where weakness is purged

buildings.name: Weapons Factory
buildings.description: Industrial forge producing disruptors and military equipment. Smoke, fire, the sound of hammering

buildings.name: Barracks
buildings.description: Spartan quarters for warriors awaiting deployment. No luxuries, only weapons racks and hard beds

buildings.name: Prison Fortress
buildings.description: Where enemies and the dishonored are held. Cells carved into rock, execution grounds, no escape

buildings.name: Defense Command
buildings.description: Military coordination center. Tactical displays, war planning rooms, heavily fortified

buildings.name: Guard Post
buildings.description: Checkpoint manned by warriors protecting vital locations, featuring disruptor emplacements

buildings.name: Training Ground
buildings.description: Open arena where warriors hone combat skills through brutal sparring with real weapons

buildings.name: Defense Tower
buildings.description: Fortified watchtower with disruptor emplacements scanning for approaching enemies

buildings.name: Bat'leth Smithy
buildings.description: Sacred workshop where master craftsmen forge the legendary sword of honor by traditional methods

buildings.name: Disruptor Factory
buildings.description: Mass production of Klingon energy weapons for the Empire's vast military forces

buildings.name: Weapons Forge
buildings.description: Traditional smithy with furnaces and anvils where legendary blades are created

buildings.name: Shipyard Control Tower
buildings.description: Industrial complex overseeing construction of warships. Smoke, sparks, the birth of birds of prey

buildings.name: Mining Complex
buildings.description: Brutal extraction facility for dilithium and metals, worked by prisoners and the dishonored

buildings.name: Ore Refinery
buildings.description: Processing plant converting raw materials into war materials for the Empire

buildings.name: Targ Kennel
buildings.description: Breeding grounds for vicious targs - used as food, war beasts, and hunting companions

buildings.name: Targ Farm
buildings.description: Large-scale targ ranching supplying meat to warriors across the colony

buildings.name: Gagh Breeding Facility
buildings.description: Cultivation of serpent worms, the Klingon staple food eaten live and wriggling

buildings.name: Bloodwine Distillery
buildings.description: Where the warrior's drink is brewed. Massive vats, aging barrels, tasting halls

buildings.name: Power Plant
buildings.description: Industrial generator powering the Empire's war factories, rugged and functional

buildings.name: Shield Generator
buildings.description: Defensive installation protecting vital military assets from orbital bombardment

buildings.name: Temple of Kahless
buildings.description: Sacred shrine to the greatest warrior, where pilgrims seek enlightenment through combat trials

buildings.name: Statue of Kahless
buildings.description: Massive monument to the legendary founder of Klingon honor, towering over the plaza

buildings.name: Memorial Obelisk
buildings.description: Stone monument inscribed with names of warriors who died gloriously in battle

buildings.name: Hall of Warriors
buildings.description: Memorial displaying statues and weapons of legendary heroes, walls inscribed with battle honors

buildings.name: Opera House
buildings.description: Grand theater for Klingon opera - tales of conquest, betrayal, and honor sung with passion

buildings.name: Museum of Conquest
buildings.description: Hall displaying trophies from the Empire's greatest victories over inferior species

buildings.name: Medical Facility
buildings.description: Spartan treatment center - true warriors prefer honorable scars to medical intervention

buildings.name: Field Hospital
buildings.description: Combat medical station for those wounded but not killed, functional and without comfort

buildings.name: Library of Honor
buildings.description: Repository of warrior wisdom, battle tactics, and the glorious histories of noble Houses

buildings.name: Diplomatic Hall
buildings.description: Training for the few who negotiate rather than conquer - still imposing architecture

buildings.name: Arena of Combat
buildings.description: Gladiatorial pit where disputes of honor are settled in blood before cheering crowds

buildings.name: Feast Hall
buildings.description: Great dining hall for victory celebrations with bloodwine, gagh, and songs of glory

buildings.name: Bloodwine Hall
buildings.description: Drinking establishment where warriors boast of battles and plot future conquests

buildings.name: Veterans Hall
buildings.description: Gathering place for old warriors to share tales of past glory and train the young

buildings.name: Landing Fortress
buildings.description: Fortified spaceport designed to repel attack during landing operations

buildings.name: Communications Hub
buildings.description: Encrypted relay station coordinating military operations across the sector

buildings.name: Sensor Tower
buildings.description: Early warning installation detecting approaching enemies before they can attack

buildings.name: Cargo Warehouse
buildings.description: Storage fortress holding supplies and weapons for the endless war machine

buildings.name: Trade Hall
buildings.description: Market where Houses exchange goods, weapons, and occasionally prisoners

buildings.name: Merchant Quarter
buildings.description: District for traders - commerce is beneath most warriors but necessary for the Empire

buildings.name: Embassy Fortress
buildings.description: Heavily fortified diplomatic mission - Klingon diplomacy is always backed by strength

buildings.name: Rehabilitation Center
buildings.description: Facility where dishonored warriors may earn back their standing through trials
